intro: Xanthophytum minus, commonly known as the lesser xanthophytum, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its leaves are narrow and often covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss in arid conditions. Xanthophytum minus is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations to its environment.
